fr.sorbonne_u.cps.replication.examples.components

Class MonitoredServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.replication.examples.components.Server
        • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.replication.examples.components.MonitoredServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, ReplicaI<java.lang.String>

    public class MonitoredServer
extends Server
implements ReplicaI<java.lang.String>
    The class MonitoredServer implements a request server that monitors its request queue size and notify a dispatcher that selects servers to dispatch them request depending on their queue sizes.

    Description

    In order to get the queue size, this component creates a customised pool of thread with a known queue object. This queue object will be sensed by the method notifyState that will send the information to the dispatcher. notifyState is called by a task that is scheduled on a dedicated schedulable pool of one thread that will executed it at a fixed rate during its whole execution.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2020-03-23

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  MonitoredServer.MonitoredServerExecutorServiceFactory
      The class MonitoredServerExecutorServiceFactory implements the executor service factory that will be used to create the pool of threads used to executed the requests on this server.
      class  MonitoredServer.ServerState
      The class ServerState implements the way the state information about this server will be sent to the dispatcher.
      protected static class  MonitoredServer.SizeChange
      The class SizeChange records a size change in the request queue with the time at which this change happen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonitoredServer

        protected MonitoredServer(java.lang.String inboundPortURI,
                          int position,
                          double mean,
                          double standardDeviation)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        create a monitored server.

        Description

        Generating a gaussian random duration is not very good because there is always a possibility to get a negative duration. The following assertion tries to force a distribution far from 0 to avoid negative random durations:

        mean > 2.0 * standardDeviation

        Yet the code must still test and correct the generated number if it is negative. These corrections make the actual distribution not to be Gaussian anymore, so results cannot be considered a statistically good enough for analysis. Another non-negative distribution would need to be used.

        Contract

         pre     inboundPortURI != null && !inboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 pre     position > 0
 pre     mean > 0.0
 pre     standardDeviation > 0.0
 pre     mean > 2.0 * standardDeviation
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        inboundPortURI - URI of the inbound port used to offer the service.
        position - a relative position for the trace window of the component.
        mean - mean processing time of a request for this server.
        standardDeviation - standard deviation of the processing time of a request for this server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

        mean > 2.0 * standardDeviation

        Yet the code must still test and correct the generated number if it is negative. These corrections make the actual distribution not to be Gaussian anymore, so results cannot be considered a statistically good enough for analysis. Another non-negative distribution would need to be used.
